importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game and the announcement of Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame spans from the previous game (Game 2) to the decisive Game 7, showing progression in the postseason series.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run in the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and pushing the series to Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners' season-high three errors—two in the second inning—proved pivotal, allowing Toronto to score early and build a 6-2 lead.
Josh Naylor’s homer in the sixth inning and a single by Eugenio Suárez scored a run, briefly giving the Mariners a lead.
Matt Brash’s wild pitch in the seventh inning allowed Guerrero Jr. to score, sealing the 6-2 victory and forcing Game 7.
Seattle becomes the first team in its history to play a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a historic milestone.
The Blue Jays' second Game 7 in franchise history, their first since 1985, highlights the significance of the matchup.
Randy Yesavage, a 2024 first-round draft pick, delivered a strong performance, throwing 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and allowing only six hits and three walks.
The Blue Jays will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 on Friday.
The game’s outcome emphasizes defensive lapses in the Mariners’ lineup and the resilience of the Blue Jays’ offense.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, helping the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2 and force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners’ season-high three defensive errors, including two in the second inning, led to early scoring for Toronto, with Barger and Kiner-Falefa opening with back-to-back RBI singles. Guerrero’s solo shot in the fifth inning extended the lead to 5-0, and a wild pitch by Matt Brash in the seventh allowed him to score, sealing the win. The Blue Jays, who have not played a Game 7 since 1985, now advance to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. The Mariners, now in their first-ever Game 7 in franchise history, will play in Toronto on Monday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
